The files only 00046 * contains the typedefs required to build FreeRTOS. Read the instructions 00047 * in FreeRTOS/source/stdint.readme for more information. 00048 */ 00049 #include <stdint.h> /* READ COMMENT ABOVE. */ 00050 00051 #ifdef __cplusplus 00052 extern "C" { 00053 #endif 00054 00055 /* Application specific configuration options. */ 00056 #include "FreeRTOSConfig.h" 00057 00058 /* Basic FreeRTOS definitions. */ 00059 #include "projdefs.h" 00060 00061 /* Definitions specific to the port being used. */ 00062 #include "portable.h" 00063 00064 /* Must be defaulted before configUSE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT is used below. */ 00065 #ifndef configUSE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT 00066 #define configUSE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT 0 00067 #endif 00068 00069 /* Required if struct _reent is used. */ 00070 #if ( configUSE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT == 1 ) 00071 #include <reent.h> 00072 #endif 00073 /* 00074 * Check all the required application specific macros have been defined. 00075 * These macros are application specific and (as downloaded) are defined 00076 * within FreeRTOSConfig.h. 00077 */ 00078 00079 #ifndef configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE 00080 #error Missing definition: configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE must be defined in FreeRTOSConfig.h. configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE defines the size (in words) of the stack allocated to the idle task. Refer to the demo project provided for your port for a suitable value. 00081 #endif 00082 00083 #ifndef configMAX_PRIORITIES 00084 #error Missing definition: configMAX_PRIORITIES must be defined in FreeRTOSConfig.h. See the Configuration section of the FreeRTOS API documentation for details. 00085 #endif 00086 00087 #if configMAX_PRIORITIES < 1 00088 #error configMAX_PRIORITIES must be defined to be greater than or equal to 1. 00089 #endif 00090 00091 #ifndef configUSE_PREEMPTION 00092 #error Missing definition: configUSE_PREEMPTION must be defined in FreeRTOSConfig.h as either 1 or 0. already held by a 00334 lower priority task. pxTCBOfMutexHolder is a pointer to the TCB of the task 00335 that holds the mutex. uxInheritedPriority is the priority the mutex holder 00336 will inherit (the priority of the task that is attempting to obtain the 00337 muted. */ 00338 #define traceTASK_PRIORITY_INHERIT( pxTCBOfMutexHolder, uxInheritedPriority ) 00339 #endif 00340 00341 #ifndef 00836 /* Sanity check the configuration. */ 00837 #if( configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE != 0 ) 00838 #if( INCLUDE_vTaskSuspend != 1 ) 00839 #error INCLUDE_vTaskSuspend must be set to 1 if configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE is not set to 0 00840 #endif /* INCLUDE_vTaskSuspend */ 00841 #endif /* configUSE_TICKLESS_IDLE */ 00842 00843 #if( ( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 0 ) && ( configUSE_RECURSIVE_MUTEXES == 1 ) && ( configUSE_MUTEXES != 1 ) ) 00848 #error configUSE_MUTEXES must be set to 1 to use recursive mutexes 00849 #endif 00850 00851 #ifndef configINITIAL_TICK_COUNT 00852 #define configINITIAL_TICK_COUNT 0 00853 #endif 00854 00855 #if( portTICK_TYPE_IS_ATOMIC == 0 ) 00856 /* Either variables of tick type cannot be read atomically, or 00857 portTICK_TYPE_IS_ATOMIC was not set - map the critical sections used when 00858 the tick count is returned to the standard critical section macros. */ 00859 #define portTICK_TYPE_ENTER_CRITICAL() portENTER_CRITICAL() 00860 #define portTICK_TYPE_EXIT_CRITICAL() portEXIT_CRITICAL() 00861 #define portTICK_TYPE_SET_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR() portSET_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR() 00862 #define portTICK_TYPE_CLEAR_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR( x ) portCLEAR_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR( ( x ) ) 00863 #else 00864 /* The tick type can be read atomically, so critical sections used when the 00865 tick count is returned can be defined away. */ 00866 #define portTICK_TYPE_ENTER_CRITICAL() 00867 #define portTICK_TYPE_EXIT_CRITICAL() 00868 #define portTICK_TYPE_SET_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR() 0 00869 #define portTICK_TYPE_CLEAR_INTERRUPT_MASK_FROM_ISR( x ) ( void ) x 00870 #endif 00871 00872 /* Definitions to allow backward compatibility with FreeRTOS versions prior to 00873 V8 if desired. */ 00874 #ifndef configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY 00875 #define configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY 1 00876 #endif 00877 00878 #ifndef configPRINTF 00879 /* configPRINTF() was not defined, so define it away to nothing. To use 00880 configPRINTF() then define it as follows (where MyPrintFunction() is 00881 provided by the application writer): 00882 00883 void MyPrintFunction(const char *pcFormat, ... ); 00884 #define configPRINTF( X ) MyPrintFunction X 00885 00886 Then call like a standard printf() function, but placing brackets around 00887 all parameters so they are passed as a single parameter. For example: 00888 configPRINTF( ("Value = %d", MyVariable) ); */ 00889 #define configPRINTF( X ) 00890 #endif 00891 00892 #ifndef configMAX 00893 /* The application writer has not provided their own MAX macro, so define 00894 the following generic implementation. */ 00895 #define configMAX( a, b ) ( ( ( a ) > ( b ) ) ? ( a ) : ( b ) ) 00896 #endif 00897 00898 #ifndef configMIN 00899 /* The application writer has not provided their own MAX macro, so define 00900 the following generic implementation. */ 00901 #define configMIN( a, b ) ( ( ( a ) < ( b ) ) ? ( a ) : ( b ) ) 00902 #endif 00903 00904 #if configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY == 1 00905 #define eTaskStateGet eTaskGetState 00906 #define portTickType TickType_t 00907 #define xTaskHandle TaskHandle_t 00908 #define xQueueHandle QueueHandle_t 00909 #define xSemaphoreHandle SemaphoreHandle_t 00910 #define xQueueSetHandle QueueSetHandle_t 00911 #define xQueueSetMemberHandle QueueSetMemberHandle_t 00912 #define xTimeOutType TimeOut_t 00913 #define xMemoryRegion MemoryRegion_t 00914 #define xTaskParameters TaskParameters_t 00915 #define xTaskStatusType TaskStatus_t 00916 #define xTimerHandle TimerHandle_t 00917 #define xCoRoutineHandle CoRoutineHandle_t 00918 #define pdTASK_HOOK_CODE TaskHookFunction_t 00919 #define portTICK_RATE_MS portTICK_PERIOD_MS 00920 #define pcTaskGetTaskName pcTaskGetName 00921 #define pcTimerGetTimerName pcTimerGetName 00922 #define pcQueueGetQueueName pcQueueGetName 00923 #define vTaskGetTaskInfo vTaskGetInfo 00924 00925 /* Backward compatibility within the scheduler code only - these definitions 00926 are not really required but are included for completeness. */ 00927 #define tmrTIMER_CALLBACK TimerCallbackFunction_t 00928 #define pdTASK_CODE TaskFunction_t 00929 #define xListItem ListItem_t 00930 #define xList List_t 00931 #endif /* configENABLE_BACKWARD_COMPATIBILITY */ 00932 00933 #if( configUSE_ALTERNATIVE_API != 0 ) 00934 #error The alternative API was deprecated some time ago, and was removed in FreeRTOS V9.0 0 00935 #endif 00936 00937 /* Set configUSE_TASK_FPU_SUPPORT to 0 to omit floating point support even 00938 if floating point hardware is otherwise supported by the FreeRTOS port in use. 00939 This constant is not supported by all FreeRTOS ports that include floating 00940 point support. */ 00941 #ifndef configUSE_TASK_FPU_SUPPORT 00942 #define configUSE_TASK_FPU_SUPPORT 1 00943 #endif 00944 00945 /* 00946 * In line with software engineering best practice, FreeRTOS implements a strict 00947 * data hiding policy, so the real structures used by FreeRTOS to maintain the 00948 * state of tasks, queues, semaphores, etc. are not accessible to the application 00949 * code. However, if the application writer wants to statically allocate such 00950 * an object then the size of the object needs to be know. Dummy structures 00951 * that are guaranteed to have the same size and alignment requirements of the 00952 * real objects are used for this purpose. The dummy list and list item 00953 * structures below are used for inclusion in such a dummy structure. 00954 */ 00955 struct xSTATIC_LIST_ITEM 00956 { 00957 TickType_t xDummy1; 00958 void *pvDummy2[ 4 ]; 00959 }; 00960 typedef struct xSTATIC_LIST_ITEM StaticListItem_t; 00961 00962 /* See the comments above the struct xSTATIC_LIST_ITEM definition. */ 00963 struct xSTATIC_MINI_LIST_ITEM 00964 { 00965 TickType_t xDummy1; 00966 void *pvDummy2[ 2 ]; 00967 }; 00968 typedef struct xSTATIC_MINI_LIST_ITEM StaticMiniListItem_t; 00969 00970 /* See the comments above the struct xSTATIC_LIST_ITEM definition. */ 00971 typedef struct xSTATIC_LIST 00972 { 00973 UBaseType_t uxDummy1; 00974 void *pvDummy2; 00975 StaticMiniListItem_t xDummy3; 00976 } StaticList_t; 00977 00978 /* 00979 * In line with software engineering best practice, especially when supplying a 00980 * library that is likely to change in future versions, FreeRTOS implements a 00981 * strict data hiding policy. This means the Task structure used internally by 00982 * FreeRTOS is not accessible to application code. However, if the application 00983 * writer wants to statically allocate the memory required to create a task then 00984 * the size of the task object needs to be know. The StaticTask_t structure 00985 * below is provided for this purpose. Its sizes and alignment requirements are 00986 * guaranteed to match those of the genuine structure, no matter which 00987 * architecture is being used, and no matter how the values in FreeRTOSConfig.h 00988 * are set. Its contents are somewhat obfuscated in the hope users will 00989 * recognise that it would be unwise to make direct use of the structure members. 00990 */ 00991 typedef struct xSTATIC_TCB 00992 { 00993 void *pxDummy1; 00994 #if ( portUSING_MPU_WRAPPERS == 1 ) 00995 xMPU_SETTINGS xDummy2; 00996 #endif 00997 StaticListItem_t xDummy3[ 2 ]; 00998 UBaseType_t uxDummy5; 00999 void *pxDummy6; 01000 uint8_t ucDummy7[ configMAX_TASK_NAME_LEN ]; 01001 #if ( ( portSTACK_GROWTH > 0 ) || ( configRECORD_STACK_HIGH_ADDRESS == 1 ) ) 01002 void *pxDummy8; 01003 #endif 01004 #if ( portCRITICAL_NESTING_IN_TCB == 1 ) 01005 UBaseType_t uxDummy9; 01006 #endif 01007 #if ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 01008 UBaseType_t uxDummy10[ 2 ]; 01009 #endif 01010 #if ( configUSE_MUTEXES == 1 ) 01011 UBaseType_t uxDummy12[ 2 ]; 01012 #endif 01013 #if ( configUSE_APPLICATION_TASK_TAG == 1 ) 01014 void *pxDummy14; 01015 #endif 01016 #if( configNUM_THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_POINTERS > 0 ) 01017 void *pvDummy15[ configNUM_THREAD_LOCAL_STORAGE_POINTERS ]; 01018 #endif 01019 #if ( configGENERATE_RUN_TIME_STATS == 1 ) 01020 uint32_t ulDummy16; 01021 #endif 01022 #if ( configUSE_NEWLIB_REENTRANT == 1 ) 01023 struct _reent xDummy17; 01024 #endif 01025 #if ( configUSE_TASK_NOTIFICATIONS == 1 ) 01026 uint32_t ulDummy18; 01027 uint8_t ucDummy19; 01028 #endif 01029 #if( ( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) && ( configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) ) 01030 uint8_t uxDummy20; 01031 #endif 01032 01033 #if( INCLUDE_xTaskAbortDelay == 1 ) 01034 uint8_t ucDummy21; 01035 #endif 01036 01037 } StaticTask_t; 01038 01039 /* 01040 * In line with software engineering best practice, especially when supplying a 01041 * library that is likely to change in future versions, FreeRTOS implements a 01042 * strict data hiding policy. This means the Queue structure used internally by 01043 * FreeRTOS is not accessible to application code. However, if the application 01044 * writer wants to statically allocate the memory required to create a queue 01045 * then the size of the queue object needs to be know. The StaticQueue_t 01046 * structure below is provided for this purpose. Its sizes and alignment 01047 * requirements are guaranteed to match those of the genuine structure, no 01048 * matter which architecture is being used, and no matter how the values in 01049 * FreeRTOSConfig.h are set. Its contents are somewhat obfuscated in the hope 01050 * users will recognise that it would be unwise to make direct use of the 01051 * structure members. 01052 */ 01053 typedef struct xSTATIC_QUEUE 01054 { 01055 void *pvDummy1[ 3 ]; 01056 01057 union 01058 { 01059 void *pvDummy2; 01060 UBaseType_t uxDummy2; 01061 } u; 01062 01063 StaticList_t xDummy3[ 2 ]; 01064 UBaseType_t uxDummy4[ 3 ]; 01065 uint8_t ucDummy5[ 2 ]; 01066 01067 #if( ( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) && ( configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) ) 01068 uint8_t ucDummy6; 01069 #endif 01070 01071 #if ( configUSE_QUEUE_SETS == 1 ) 01072 void *pvDummy7; 01073 #endif 01074 01075 #if ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 01076 UBaseType_t uxDummy8; 01077 uint8_t ucDummy9; 01078 #endif 01079 01080 } StaticQueue_t; 01081 typedef StaticQueue_t StaticSemaphore_t; 01082 01083 /* 01084 * In line with software engineering best practice, especially when supplying a 01085 * library that is likely to change in future versions, FreeRTOS implements a 01086 * strict data hiding policy. This means the event group structure used 01087 * internally by FreeRTOS is not accessible to application code. However, if 01088 * the application writer wants to statically allocate the memory required to 01089 * create an event group then the size of the event group object needs to be 01090 * know. The StaticEventGroup_t structure below is provided for this purpose. 01091 * Its sizes and alignment requirements are guaranteed to match those of the 01092 * genuine structure, no matter which architecture is being used, and no matter 01093 * how the values in FreeRTOSConfig.h are set. Its contents are somewhat 01094 * obfuscated in the hope users will recognise that it would be unwise to make 01095 * direct use of the structure members. 01096 */ 01097 typedef struct xSTATIC_EVENT_GROUP 01098 { 01099 TickType_t xDummy1; 01100 StaticList_t xDummy2; 01101 01102 #if( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 01103 UBaseType_t uxDummy3; 01104 #endif 01105 01106 #if( ( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) && ( configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) ) 01107 uint8_t ucDummy4; 01108 #endif 01109 01110 } StaticEventGroup_t; 01111 01112 /* 01113 * In line with software engineering best practice, especially when supplying a 01114 * library that is likely to change in future versions, FreeRTOS implements a 01115 * strict data hiding policy. This means the software timer structure used 01116 * internally by FreeRTOS is not accessible to application code. However, if 01117 * the application writer wants to statically allocate the memory required to 01118 * create a software timer then the size of the queue object needs to be know. 01119 * The StaticTimer_t structure below is provided for this purpose. Its sizes 01120 * and alignment requirements are guaranteed to match those of the genuine 01121 * structure, no matter which architecture is being used, and no matter how the 01122 * values in FreeRTOSConfig.h are set. Its contents are somewhat obfuscated in 01123 * the hope users will recognise that it would be unwise to make direct use of 01124 * the structure members. 01125 */ 01126 typedef struct xSTATIC_TIMER 01127 { 01128 void *pvDummy1; 01129 StaticListItem_t xDummy2; 01130 TickType_t xDummy3; 01131 UBaseType_t uxDummy4; 01132 void *pvDummy5; 01133 TaskFunction_t pvDummy6; 01134 #if( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 01135 UBaseType_t uxDummy7; 01136 #endif 01137 01138 #if( ( configSUPPORT_STATIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) && ( configSUPPORT_DYNAMIC_ALLOCATION == 1 ) ) 01139 uint8_t ucDummy8; 01140 #endif 01141 01142 } StaticTimer_t; 01143 01144 /* 01145 * In line with software engineering best practice, especially when supplying a 01146 * library that is likely to change in future versions, FreeRTOS implements a 01147 * strict data hiding policy. This means the stream buffer structure used 01148 * internally by FreeRTOS is not accessible to application code. However, if 01149 * the application writer wants to statically allocate the memory required to 01150 * create a stream buffer then the size of the stream buffer object needs to be 01151 * know. The StaticStreamBuffer_t structure below is provided for this purpose. 01152 * Its size and alignment requirements are guaranteed to match those of the 01153 * genuine structure, no matter which architecture is being used, and no matter 01154 * how the values in FreeRTOSConfig.h are set. Its contents are somewhat 01155 * obfuscated in the hope users will recognise that it would be unwise to make 01156 * direct use of the structure members. 01157 */ 01158 typedef struct xSTATIC_STREAM_BUFFER 01159 { 01160 size_t uxDummy1[ 4 ]; 01161 void * pvDummy2[ 3 ]; 01162 uint8_t ucDummy3; 01163 #if ( configUSE_TRACE_FACILITY == 1 ) 01164 UBaseType_t uxDummy4; 01165 #endif 01166 } StaticStreamBuffer_t; 01167 01168 /* Message buffers are built on stream buffers. */ 01169 typedef StaticStreamBuffer_t StaticMessageBuffer_t; 01170 01171 #ifdef __cplusplus 01172 } 01173 #endif 01174 01175 #endif /* INC_FREERTOS_H */ 01176
